subject: In JUnit 4.1, how do you tell the test runner to stop running tests?
msgSnippet: I m using Eclipse 3.2 using the JUnit 4.1 test runner along with ANT 1.7.0beta1 to do development, and then when I deploy everything is executed from ANT
messageBody:
I'm using Eclipse 3.2 using the JUnit 4.1 test runner along with ANT
1.7.0beta1 to do development, and then when I deploy everything is
executed from ANT 1.7.0beta1 using JUnit 4.1 with the <junit> and
<junitreport> tasks.

In my JUnit test class I have a @BeforeClass method which checks to
make sure that the necessary properties (arguments) have been passed
before even beginning the test methods. In my @BeforeClass method, how
do I tell the runner to exit?
I've looked through UserStopTest.java, and I know that the secret lies
somewhere in accessing the runner notifier and using the pleaseStop()
method, but it is eluding me.

If someone could drop an example that would be great!
